User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the SyncStream platform.

Room.title: Room
Room.description: Represents a room where users can watch or listen together.

hostId.description: Reference to the User who is the host of the room. (Relationship: User 1:N Room)

RoomUser.title: RoomUser
RoomUser.description: Connects Users to Rooms, tracking presence in the application. (Many-to-many relationship between User and Room).

id.description: Unique identifier for the user's presence in the room.

roomId.description: Reference to the Room. (Relationship: Room 1:N RoomUser)

userId.description: Reference to the User. (Relationship: User 1:N RoomUser)

joinedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user joined the room.

Media.title: Media
Media.description: Represents a media file (video or audio) being shared in a room.

url.description: The URL where the media is hosted.

uploadDate.description: The date the media was uploaded

type.description: the type of media it is, for example it could be 'mp4', 'mp3', 'mkv'.

roomId.description: Reference to the Room in which the media is being shared. (Relationship: Room 1:N Media)

thumbnailUrl.description: A URL to a thumbnail for the media

ChatMessage.title: ChatMessage
ChatMessage.description: Represents a chat message sent within a room. It can contain text, and optionally, media.

id.description: Unique identifier for the chat message.

roomId.description: Reference to the Room where the message was sent. (Relationship: Room 1:N ChatMessage)

userId.description: Reference to the User who sent the message. (Relationship: User 1:N ChatMessage)

message.description: The content of the chat message.

timestamp.description: Timestamp indicating when the message was sent.

mediaUrl.description: URL of the uploaded image or video. This is optional.

mediaType.description: Type of the media, if any. This is optional.

definition.description: Stores user profiles. Uses path-based ownership for private user data.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to support SyncStream's real-time collaborative media viewing. It prioritizes authorization independence and clear security rules, crucial for collaborative applications.

Users are stored in a standard `/users/{userId}` collection. Rooms are also top-level collections, enabling easy listing. The `RoomUser` entity is used for tracking room participation and presence.  Media and ChatMessages are stored as subcollections of rooms to scope the data.

**Authorization Independence:**
*   `rooms`:  Authorization is managed through the `hostId` property within each room.  A user can only modify or delete a room where they are the host.
*   `rooms/{roomId}/media`: Access to media is determined by membership in the room. Security rules will validate if `request.auth.uid` exists as a member in the `members` map denormalized inside the room document before creating or modifying media.
*   `rooms/{roomId}/chatMessages`: Similar to media, access to chat messages is controlled by room membership.

**QAPs (Rules are not Filters):**
*   The segregation of data into `/users` and `/rooms` collections allows for simple `list` operations based on ownership or membership.

**Denormalization Strategy:**
*   The `rooms` collection does not contain `members` subcollections but will have an attribute `members` of type map in each document. This ensures that when we need to query, modify, or delete objects in the `/rooms/{roomId}/media` collection we are not required to make a `get()` call to the parent to check the access.
*   When a user creates a room, their `uid` will be added to the `members` map.
